purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the assignment of properties to a particular representation of a document version or a file.

inscope.li: assignment of properties to a particular representation of a document version;
assignment of properties to a file;
specification of the representation of document-specific properties;
items within the scope of application module Document definition, ISO/TS 10303-1123;
items within the scope of application module File identification, ISO/TS 10303-1127;
items within the scope of application module Foundation representation, ISO/TS 10303-1006;
items within the scope of application module Measure representation, ISO/TS 10303-1118;
items within the scope of application module Property assignment, ISO/TS 10303-1030.

outscope.li: Identification of documents and versions of documents.

alt_map.description: If the Assigned_document_property applies to a Digital_document_definition.
alt_map.refpath: property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_product_definition characterized_product_definition = product_definition {product_definition.frame_of_reference -> product_definition_context product_definition_context <= application_context_element application_context_element.name = 'digital document definition'}

alt_map.description: If the Assigned_document_property applies to a Physical_document_definition.
alt_map.refpath: property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_product_definition characterized_product_definition = product_definition {product_definition.frame_of_reference -> product_definition_context product_definition_context <= application_context_element application_context_element.name = 'physical document definition'}

alt_map.description: If the Assigned_document_property applies to a Digital_File.
alt_map.refpath: property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_object characterized_object => document_file {document_file <= document document <- document_representation_type.represented_document document_representation_type.name = 'digital'}

alt_map.description: If the Assigned_document_property applies to a Hardcopy.
alt_map.refpath: property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_object characterized_object => document_file {document_file <= document document <- document_representation_type.represented_document document_representation_type.name = 'physical'}
